title: A Fun Music Maker Goes to Eurovision for the UK
summary: Look Mum No Computer is a music artist and YouTuber who makes cool electronic instruments like keyboards from toys. He has been chosen to represent the UK at the Eurovision Song Contest in Vienna this year. He is very excited and says it is an honor to be part of this big music show that many people love. He started as Sam Battle in a band called Zibra and now performs solo. He has lots of followers online and creates unique music machines. The BBC picked him because they think he is creative and will do a great job. His song is not out yet, but a DJ says it mixes different fun styles. This is a big chance for the UK to try something new at Eurovision.

background_read: Eurovision is a yearly song contest where countries from Europe and beyond send artists to perform original songs. It started in 1956 and is watched by millions of people on TV. The UK has been part of it for many years, sometimes winning but often getting mixed results. Look Mum No Computer is a modern artist who uses technology to make music in fun ways, which is different from traditional singers. This choice shows the UK wants to be more creative and stand out in the competition.
